TopicTitle: KSP live streams and Youtube videos

Articles.Content:
we all love KSP right?

so what could be just as good as playing KSP? watching others fail at KSP ;P

I just wanted to create a nice little corner where us fans could post our stuff and you guys could find it.

so let me start off by posting my goodies, probably not as good as the stuff on the interwebs atm

CAUTION: foul language afoot here!!!

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4897AB4A235A1966&feature=plcp

also would anyone be interesting in seeing a live stream? if i can build enough interest i\'ll most definatley do one... until then you guys get your stuff on here and lets fill up this thread

Honorable mentions:

http://www.youtube.com/user/trydyingtolive?feature=results_main

a livestream currently happening, check this guy out and the awsome craft he is making

http://www.twitch.tv/andyjfaulkner
I watched the first of your vids, it looks like a good introduction to the game

lol if your on about my vids, i wouldnt call THAT a good introduction lmao. half the time i dnt have a clue what im talking about and try to explain it as best i can, hell i been playin this game for a while now an i still dnt know what a delta-v is...

lol if your on about my vids, i wouldnt call THAT a good introduction lmao. half the time i dnt have a clue what im talking about and try to explain it as best i can, hell i been playin this game for a while now an i still dnt know what a delta-v is...

Delta V is change in velocity. Just FYI.

ahhhh i see, so if i understand you correct, that if an object travels at say 30m/s and then changes to 40m/s the delta-v would be the unit that describes the 10m/s difference? im not the smartest tool in the shed, but this stuff is quite interesting

ahhhh i see, so if i understand you correct, that if an object travels at say 30m/s and then changes to 40m/s the delta-v would be the unit that describes the 10m/s difference? im not the smartest tool in the shed, but this stuff is quite interesting

I\'m not exactly an expert on this stuff either, but I do believe that is the case.

It\'s a useful metric because it can gauge engine capacity/efficiency (ie, how much fuel do I need to get this dv? or how much dv can I get out of this engine with this mass attached? How long do I need to burn my engine to get this dv?), and also it is related to orbital maneuvers (if I want to raise my apoapsis from 100km to 150km how much dv do I need?) and, by extension, injections (how much dv do I need for a TMI from 300km altitude?)

I have never used it, but as far as I have gathered it forms the basis for many of the calculations involved in spaceflight planning. This is of course because velocity necessarily has a direct impact upon trajectories.

Now, someone who really knows their stuff can come and correct me where I am wrong.

a livestream currently happening, check this guy out and the awsome craft he is making

Live streaming again now, current project:

Launch a plane into space and land on the runway.

Feel free to pop by to criticise and throw advice my way on why it\'s enevitably going horribly wrong!

Thankyou

Live streaming again now, current project:

Launch a plane into space and land on the runway.

Feel free to pop by to criticise and throw advice my way on why it\'s enevitably going horribly wrong!

I watched a little bit of it yesterday, and I have one tip for you.

Next time you are going in for a landing, don\'t go in at full throttle!

Just switch your engines off and glide down. That\'s what I do, works a treat. Pull up and expose as much of your wingspan as possible to the oncoming air in order to slow down, and then dive a little to drop further toward the ground, then pull up again, then drop again etc... Works fine for me.

Yeah I have my own Youtube channel and Live stream.

It\'s rather difficult to get everything right.

Epically sound levels. Got any tips for that?

if your talking about the in-game sounds, turn both your engines and ambiance down to about 15%, for your mic you can right click your speaker in the bottom right and adjust the mic settings, i have mine boosted up to +30 as mine is pretty quite.

also get your link for you youtube on here 8) cnt watch them if you dnt post them

I have never used it, but as far as I have gathered it forms the basis for many of the calculations involved in spaceflight planning. This is of course because velocity necessarily has a direct impact upon trajectories.

Now, someone who really knows their stuff can come and correct me where I am wrong.

Calculations?

Planning?? >

I just boost up then sideways. If it doesn\'t work, add more boosters.

...On an unrelated note, there is a very high casualty rate for kerbinauts. Maybe that\'s why they never get life insurance.

gonna go live on twitch.tv at about 3:30pm GMT.... my second ever live stream, my first ever solo one....

so come on down and get involved
